alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:42PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cochise County through 230 PM MST... At 141 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles west of Cloverdale, or 18 miles east of Douglas, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bisbee-Douglas Airport and Rucker Canyon. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 371 and 398. Route 191 between mile markers 7 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
